intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium psilolainzii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture, and its flowers are yellow, often with a central dark center. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
